title: Clinton tells Congress he had 'no inkling' of Epstein's crimes | ABC NEWS
description: Former US president Bill Clinton has been grilled in congress for six hours over his ties to the late sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein. In the landmark deposition, Mr Clinton maintained he knew nothing of Epstein's crimes and blasted the committee for summoning his wife to testify just a day earlier. description: Israel has launched strikes against Iran, with witnesses reporting blasts in the capital, Tehran. Israel's Defence Minister, Israel Katz, confirmed Israel is attacking Iran. title: Authorities investigate motivation behind alleged foiled terror plot in WA | ABC NEWS
description: Authorities say they are working to identify Australians who belonged to the same encrypted online group chat as a WA man charged with planning a terrorist attack on Mosques and government buildings. title: Trump confirms 'major combat operations' in Iran | ABC NEWS
description: In an eight-minute video posted to social media, Donald Trump has confirmed US involvement in "major combat operations" in Iran. In the video, Trump said the "menacing activities" of the Iranian regime were a danger to "the United States, our troops, our bases overseas, and our allies throughout the world". ABC Americas editor John Lyons said after watching the video, his main impression was the substance of the speech was being driven by Israel. title: Bill Clinton says he had 'no idea' about Epstein's crimes | ABC NEWS
description: Bill Clinton says he had no inkling of Jeffrey Epstein's criminal behaviour during their "brief acquaintance" and he would have reported the paedophile to police if he did, according to his opening statement to a congressional hearing. The former US president was questioned for more than six hours by the House Oversight Committee, which is looking into the US government's handling of the Epstein case.  Afterwards, Republicans on the committee praised Mr Clinton's candour and said they "picked up some new facts". Mr Clinton was subpoenaed after featuring prominently in the first release of select "Epstein files" documents last year, including in undated photographs with Epstein and his accomplice, Ghislaine Maxwell.
